name: Lentil Soup
description: Classic Turkish red lentil soup with a creamy texture. Protein and fiber rich comfort food.

instructions.instruction: Rinse lentils thoroughly under running water until water runs clear.
Heat 1 tbsp butter and olive oil in large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and saut√© 5 minutes until soft.
instructions.tip: Onions should be translucent, not browned.

instructions.instruction: Add carrot, potato, and garlic. Cook 2 minutes.
Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Add lentils and stir to combine.
Add hot water or broth. Bring to boil.
Reduce heat, partially cover, simmer 25-30 minutes until lentils are falling apart.
Blend soup until smooth with immersion blender or regular blender.
instructions.tip: Be careful with hot liquids - leave lid slightly open.

instructions.instruction: Season with salt. Adjust consistency - add water if too thick.
For topping: Melt remaining butter in small pan. Add pepper flakes, mint, and cumin. Cook 30 seconds.
Ladle soup into bowls, drizzle spiced butter on top. Serve with lemon wedges.

tips: Lentils are plant-based protein and iron source.
Lemon juice improves iron absorption - always squeeze some.
Soup thickens as it sits - add water when reheating.
Dried mint and pepper flakes are essential - don't skip.
For vegan, replace butter with olive oil.
storageInfo: Refrigerate 5 days, freeze 3 months. Add water when reheating.
servingSuggestion: Serve hot with crusty bread and lemon wedges. Cold weather essential.
variations: Add coconut milk for creamy version.
